comments.body:
I'm not terribly excited about using the term "flat transaction", but I also want to avoid just changing the type for the field name `transaction` from `TransactionTree` to `Transaction`.
Notice: renaming a field doesn't break wire compatibility.
i don't quite like this behaviour, why can't we have separate service endpoints instead?

How would you suggest migrating to new names? Change `GetTransactionByEventId` to return flat transactions, and add a new method `GetTransactionTreeByEventId`? Unfortunately that original mixed naming (using `Transaction` when we're actually returning a `TransactionTree`) doesn't really play into our favor right now :(
fair enough, discussed the trade-off offline
Conclusion: we rather want to have the functionality now with sub-par naming (and sufficient documentation to mitigate that), than wait for a new version of the Ledger API to land.
